resources.string:
DNS stands for Domain Name System.

The Domain Name System is used to resolve Domains (google.com, yahoo.com, example.com...) to IP Addresses (192.168.178.1 for example) to communicate over the Internet.

It is one of the most important systems used in IP-based networks.

This App works without a rooted phone. 

To make this possible all traffic is redirected using a VPN. This VPN redirects your traffic only locally, the data never leaves your phone using this VPN connection.

You'll be asked to allow the VPN connection in the next window, without permission from you the set DNS servers won't work.


Source code can be found under https://git.frostnerd.com/PublicAndroidApps/DnsChanger.
Show a notification when DNSChanger is running
Automatically start DNSChanger when your phone is turned on
Automatically turn on DNS Changer when connecting to a wifi network
Automatically turn on DNS Changer when connecting to a mobile network

Permission to start the VPN denied. 
This could be the system denying vpn connections being started from the background for safety reasons.

Open the app to start the VPN
Would you like to rate this app?\nIt\'d help spreading it and shows appreciation of my work.
Please check the validity of your input
Press back again to leave (Discards changes!)

This app is set to start the vpn when the type of your network changes (Either Wifi or 3G).\\nThis might conflict with this tasker plugin as the action might be overridden by the app itself (Only one VPN can be running at any given time).\\n\\n Do you want to disable these conflicting settings?
DNSChanger was started using Tasker. Stopping it may interrupt with it. Starting it not using tasker does not apply the DNS Servers configured using Tasker. Stop anyway?
This app supports Tasker and can be used as an action plugin to automate DNS usage.
Show the currently used DNS servers in the notification
Show general info about this app
Warning: Using any of these might interfere with active Tasker profiles using this app!

This app was made by Daniel Wolf (frostnerd.com)

It uses icon made by Google (Material icon pack - https://material.io/icons/)


If you are missing a feature, found a bug or just got a general request, feel free to contact me at support@frostnerd.com
The Sourcecode to this app can be viewed at https://git.frostnerd.com/PublicAndroidApps/DnsChanger

Warning: your Android version (4.4) is known to have problems with VPN connections. If this app crashes or just doesn\'t work it\'s most likely your system and not the fault of this app.\nI\'m sorry for the inconvenience.
Automatically pause the DNS when certain apps are in the foreground (available in the next version)
You choose to pinprotect this app. Please enter the pin you provided in the settings (default: 1234)
Ask for the pin when stopping/pausing DNSChanger from the notification
Ask for the pin when starting the app

To automatically pause DNSChanger when a certain app is in the front, this app needs access to usage data. 

In the next window, please grant DNSChanger access to this data or else you won't be able to use this setting.


No data execept for currently running applications is requested. No data is saved or transmitted.
The source code is publicy available at https://git.frostnerd.com/PublicAndroidApps/DnsChanger if you want to make sure yourself.
Access to usage data was granted. Click here to revoke that permission.
Each App marked will pause DNSChanger automatically when being in the front. This might be useful as for instance in the store apps can\'t be downloaded when running with a changed DNS.

"On some Android versions (4.4, some 5.0 versions) and custom ROMs the underlying VPN structure doesn't work and leads to crashes.

The App crashed unexpectedly which most likely indicates that your phone doesn't support how this app operates.
If that's the case you could help me by sending the crash report, but sadly this app doesn't work on your device. "
Ask for the pin when starting/stopping from QuickSettings
Automatically disable when changing network (e.g Wifi to 3G). DNSChanger will activate again if set so in the previous settings.
Sharing this app with your friends or other people would really help alot spreading this app.
Hey, have a look at this DNS changing app for android. You can download it here: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.frostnerd.dnschanger
Export the settings into a file.
Imports the settings from a file
